responsibilities: Plan, design, maintain, and execute test cases with minimal direction based on specification documents and access to databases.
Stand up and execute a wide breadth of tests with scripts and tools.
Report bugs with impeccable isolation and regression techniques.
Manage priorities and communicate progress and risk effectively and systematically.
Coordinate cross-functional test efforts with other team members.
Engage in continual dialogue with Engineering and Design as products evolve.
Advocate effectively on behalf of users.
Streamline processes for data collection and systematically parse large data sets.
Ensure the successful delivery of a quality product by performing ad-hoc and structured tests.
skills: Proficient in one or more compiled languages: e.g. Swift, Objective-C, Java, C++.
Proficient in one or more scripting languages (system automations / web development): e.g. Python, Go, Scala, JavaScript, Bash.
Experience with test frameworks such as JUnit, XCTest, XCUI.
Familiar with SDLC practices (Agile vs. Waterfall, SCM, issue tracking).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to identify opportunities for technical improvement.
Comfortable with *nix commands and shell scripting environments.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate across teams.
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on testing, bug reporting, and quality assurance. The tasks include planning, designing, maintaining, and executing test cases, reporting bugs, managing priorities, coordinating cross-functional test efforts, and ensuring the delivery of a quality product. These responsibilities are typical for a software testing or quality assurance role and do not specifically mention working with Generative AI or language models.

The skills required include proficiency in compiled and scripting languages, experience with test frameworks, familiarity with software development lifecycle practices, problem-solving skills, and communication skills. These skills are relevant to software development and testing but do not specifically indicate work with Generative AI or language models.

Overall, there is no mention of Generative AI, language models, or related technologies in either the responsibilities or the skills. The focus is on software testing and quality assurance, which can be applied to a wide range of software products, not specifically those involving GenAI or LLMs.
